intro: Psychotria longivaginalis, commonly known as the long-leaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale green. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage. However, it is important to note that some species within the Psychotria genus contain toxic alkaloids, so caution is advised when handling or consuming any part of the plant.
